title: How to Make Brick Oven Pizza

steps.headline: Pour 1 cup of water in a large bowl.
steps.description: Spread the yeast and allow it to stand for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir in the 1 cup of cold water and sprinkle the salt.
Add 1 cup of bread flour and stir.
steps.description: Add 1 more bread flour and stir again, and for the last time, add the remaining bread flour and stir until the bread flour doesn't stick onto the bowl anymore.

steps.headline: Put the dough in a floured and clean surface.
Divide it into to pieces, and form it into a tight ball.
steps.description: Coat it with the olive oil and refrigerate in a sealed big container for at least 16 hours. Make sure the container is big enough for the dough to rise.

steps.headline: Remove the dough from the refrigerator for about 1 hour prior to using.
Preheat the oven with a pizza stone on the lowest rack to 550 F. Lightly dust the pizza peel with flour.
Using one ball of dough at a time, dust it with a flour.
steps.description: Stretch it to reach the size of the pizza stone or until 14 inches (35.6 cm) in the diameter.

steps.headline: Place on the floured peel.
steps.description: Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese then grind the black pepper over it.

steps.headline: Randomly arrange the tomatoes, leaving empty spaces and coat with olive oil again.
In a back and forth jerk, make sure the pizza can be released from the peel quickly.
Place the peel at the tip of the preheated pizza stone then remove the peel so the pizza will left to the pizza stone.
Bake with 4 to 6 minutes or until the pizza turns brown.
Sprinkle the basil and cut into wedges.

text: Pour 1 cup of water in a large bowl. Spread the yeast and allow it to stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the 1 cup of cold water and sprinkle the salt.  Add 1 cup of bread flour and stir. Add 1 more bread flour and stir again, and for the last time, add the remaining bread flour and stir until the bread flour doesn't stick onto the bowl anymore. Put the dough in a floured and clean surface. Knead the dough for 10 minutes. Divide it into to pieces, and form it into a tight ball. Coat it with the olive oil and refrigerate in a sealed big container for at least 16 hours. Make sure the container is big enough for the dough to rise. Remove the dough from the refrigerator for about 1 hour prior to using.  Preheat the oven with a pizza stone on the lowest rack to 550 F. Lightly dust the pizza peel with flour.  Using one ball of dough at a time, dust it with a flour. Stretch it to reach the size of the pizza stone or until 14 inches (35.6 cm) in the diameter. Place on the floured peel. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese then grind the black pepper over it. Randomly arrange the tomatoes, leaving empty spaces and coat with olive oil again.  In a back and forth jerk, make sure the pizza can be released from the peel quickly.  Place the peel at the tip of the preheated pizza stone then remove the peel so the pizza will left to the pizza stone.  Bake with 4 to 6 minutes or until the pizza turns brown.  Sprinkle the basil and cut into wedges.  Serve with beer and hot.

Spread the yeast and allow it to stand for 5 minutes.
Stir in the 1 cup of cold water and sprinkle the salt.
Add 1 cup of bread flour and stir.
Add 1 more bread flour and stir again, and for the last time, add the remaining bread flour and stir until the bread flour doesn't stick onto the bowl anymore.
Put the dough in a floured and clean surface.
Knead the dough for 10 minutes.
Divide it into to pieces, and form it into a tight ball.
Coat it with the olive oil and refrigerate in a sealed big container for at least 16 hours.
Make sure the container is big enough for the dough to rise.
Remove the dough from the refrigerator for about 1 hour prior to using.
Preheat the oven with a pizza stone on the lowest rack to 550 F. Lightly dust the pizza peel with flour.
Using one ball of dough at a time, dust it with a flour.
Stretch it to reach the size of the pizza stone or until 14 inches (35.6 cm) in the diameter.
Place on the floured peel.
Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese then grind the black pepper over it.
Randomly arrange the tomatoes, leaving empty spaces and coat with olive oil again.
In a back and forth jerk, make sure the pizza can be released from the peel quickly.
Place the peel at the tip of the preheated pizza stone then remove the peel so the pizza will left to the pizza stone.
Bake with 4 to 6 minutes or until the pizza turns brown.
Sprinkle the basil and cut into wedges.
Serve with beer and hot.
